DataElement.preferredName: Circulating Tumor Cell Specimen Repeat Collection Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was a repeat collection of peripheral blood as a circulating tumor cell specimen, metastatic cancer cells found in a specimen of peripheral blood.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Circulating Tumor Cell Specimen Repeat Collection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the repeat collection of peripheral blood as a circulating tumor cell specimen, metastatic cancer cells found in a specimen of peripheral blood.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A metastatic cancer cell found in the peripheral blood.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A metastatic cancer cell found in the peripheral blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Make or do or perform again.:The act of gathering something together.

Concepts.definition: Make or do or perform again.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
